bestPractices.title: Tracking Progress
bestPractices.description: Yearly progress tracked through indicators based on annual goals

bestPractices.title: Design guidelines
bestPractices.description: Ensure new development fits into character of community

bestPractices.title: Technical assistance
bestPractices.description: For communities and developers planning housing development

bestPractices.title: Tax Abatements/Exemptions
bestPractices.description: Tax abatements/exemptions to renovate multifamily buildings

bestPractices.title: Matching grants
bestPractices.description: Massachusetts Preservation Projects Fund provides matching grants to protect and support development of properities on the Registry of Historic Places

bestPractices.title: NOAH Impact Fund
bestPractices.description: Provides equity investments to non-profit developers and for-profit owner-operators to support the preservation of naturally occuring affordable rental housing

bestPractices.title: Housing Acquisition Program
bestPractices.description: Funding for private developers, nonprofits, CDCs, (etc.) to purchase rental buildings/units with the purpose of keeping them affordable in perpetuity

bestPractices.title: Federal Low Income Housing Tax Credits (LIHTC)
bestPractices.description: Provides funding for affordable rental housing development through tax credits

bestPractices.title: State Low Income Housing Tax Credits
bestPractices.description: MA state tax low income housing credit program, modeled after LIHTC

bestPractices.title: Permanent financing
bestPractices.description: MassDevelopment offers grants for loans for permanent financing of affordable rental housing

bestPractices.title: Community Scale Housing Initative (CSHI)
bestPractices.description: Provides funding for small-scale projects in communities with less than 200,000 people

bestPractices.title: Community development financing institutions (CDFI)
bestPractices.description: Provide credit and financial services to under-served markets and populations

bestPractices.title: Tax Increment Financing (DIF in Massachusetts)
bestPractices.description: Captures increases in property values within a defined zone to fund public amenities and infrastructure improvements within that zone

bestPractices.title: Tax Increment Financing (as interpreted in MA)
bestPractices.description: Municipalities may grant property tax exemptions to landowners of up to 100% of the tax increment for a fixed period in exchange for redevelopment activities in within a specified district

bestPractices.title: Place-based TIF
bestPractices.description: Center TIF financing in particular muncipality areas around transportation nodes or other high-value public infrastructure

bestPractices.title: Community Preservation Act (CPA)
bestPractices.description: Funds to support planning, pre-development activites, and directly fund affordable housing

bestPractices.title: MGL Chapter 40S
bestPractices.description: School cost reimbursement if a community is engaging in smart growth development

bestPractices.title: HOME Investment Partnerships Program
bestPractices.description: Grants to States and localities to fund a wide range of activities, including building, buying and/or rehabilitating affordable housing for rent or homeownership

bestPractices.title: Employer-supported housing
bestPractices.description: Financial contribution or support for employee housing from large companies employing a high number of people

bestPractices.title: Federal Home Loan Bank Affordable Housing Program (FHLB)
bestPractices.description: Provides grants, interest subsidies, and advances to rental and ownership projects for affordable housing

bestPractices.title: Obligation Bonds
bestPractices.description: Obligation bonds for affordable housing

bestPractices.title: Credit Enhancement
bestPractices.description: Local government backs a loan or bond for an affordable housing project to make it more attractive for banks + investors, lowering interest rates

bestPractices.title: Housing Trust Fund
bestPractices.description: Dedicated source of funding for affordable housing projects, can serve as a 'deposit box' for linkage fees, PILUs, TIFs and other affordable housing payment systems

bestPractices.title: Transferable Development Rights Bank
bestPractices.description: City purchases and holds TDR rights in bank, and is able to sell them to private developers

bestPractices.title: National Housing Trust Fund
bestPractices.description: Provides communities with funds to build, preserve, and rehabilitate rental homes for low-income households

bestPractices.title: State Housing Bond Fund Programs
bestPractices.description: Long-term housing bonds for specific housing programs

bestPractices.title: Social Impact Bonds
bestPractices.description: Performance-based contract where private and/or philanthropic lenders loan funds to accomplish a specific objective (e.g. homelessness mitigation, affordable housing production) and are repaid based on whether the program achieves its goals

bestPractices.title: Housing Choice Program
bestPractices.description: Funding for capital projects of municipalities that have achieved the Housing Choice designation

bestPractices.title: Private funding for homeownership
bestPractices.description: Allow private companies to support households interested in buying a house share a mortgage

bestPractices.title: Planning for Housing Production Program
bestPractices.description: Municipalities with a SHI of less than 13% can apply, supports new zoning, public infrastructure improvements, community development, and education for increased housing production

bestPractices.title: TOD Fund
bestPractices.description: Enable acquisition of property within existing or planned public transit stations + construction loans for developers of TOD affordable housing

bestPractices.title: Public Land for Affordable Housing
bestPractices.description: Surplus or underutilized land is donated, sold, or leased for affordable housing development

bestPractices.title: Housing Levy
bestPractices.description: Property taxes dedicated to affordable housing for low-income

bestPractices.title: Dedicated Tax Revenue
bestPractices.description: Percentage of a sales tax for affordable housing

bestPractices.title: Construction Excise Tax
bestPractices.description: Local jurisdiction can levy a tax of up to 1 percent of the permit value on residential construction. They may also levy a non-capped tax on the permit value of commercial and industrial construction. Revenue must go to incentives for developers Â to create affordable housing, affordable housing programs, and to down payment assistance

bestPractices.title: Linkage Fees
bestPractices.description: Developers of non-residential projects contribute a fee for affordable housing development

bestPractices.title: Impact Fees
bestPractices.description: Support the increased role of neighborhoods in determining the use of impact fees to support affordable housing

bestPractices.title: Real Estate Transfer Fee
bestPractices.description: Dedicated source of funding usually applied as percent of sales price or set dollar amount per $1000 of value property sold on real estate transactions

bestPractices.title: Mortgage Refinance Fee
bestPractices.description: $75 fee charged everytime someone refinances a mortgage dedicated towards affordable housing development and planning

bestPractices.title: Property Tax Exemption/Abatement
bestPractices.description: Exempt privately owned multifamily housing from property taxes

bestPractices.title: Property Tax Exemption/Abatement
bestPractices.description: Exempts non-profit mutlifamily housing from property taxes

bestPractices.title: Property Tax Exemption/Abatement
bestPractices.description: Tax abatements/exemptions for landlords who commit to provide below market-rent housing

bestPractices.title: Property Tax Exemption/Abatement
bestPractices.description: Tax abatements/exemptions for low-income homeowners, veterans, seniors, or other special classes of individuals

bestPractices.title: Pre-development Funding
bestPractices.description: Massachusetts Housing Partnership and CEDAC provides funding for technical assistance and pre-development activities

bestPractices.title: Pre-development loans
bestPractices.description: MassDevelopment offers grants for brownfield site assessment

bestPractices.title: Inclusionary Zoning
bestPractices.description: New residential development in certain zones must include some proportion of affordable housing units or meet some other type of compliance

bestPractices.title: TOD Overlays
bestPractices.description: New developments in a TOD overlay must include some proportion of affordable housing units or meet some other type of compliance

bestPractices.title: Upzones + Rezones
bestPractices.description: Increase capacity for new residential development to include affordable housing

bestPractices.title: Planned unit development
bestPractices.description: Allow developers flexibility to depart from existing zoning requirements in exchange for fulfilling a set of planning criteria, can include affordable housing

bestPractices.title: Accessory Dwelling Units Type and Occupancy
bestPractices.description: By-right ADU's (carved out, attached, detached, basement/attic conversions) to be built and to be occupied by non-family occupants. Allow ADU's without owner occupancy of main structure.

bestPractices.title: Flexible single-family zoning regulations
bestPractices.description: Permit standards to vary from those prescribed in the zoning code to allow for denser, more diverse development

bestPractices.title: Form-based zoning
bestPractices.description: Focuses on character of neighborhood over land use separation and includes design guidelines

bestPractices.title: Lot size averaging
bestPractices.description: Allows individual lot size within a development to vary from the zoned maximum density, provided that the average size in the development as a whole meets the maximum. Housing can be developed on smaller lots at a greater density.

bestPractices.title: Minimum densities
bestPractices.description: Ensure development isn't ocurring at much lower densities than those intended.

bestPractices.title: Eliminating maximum densities
bestPractices.description: Focus on building form over unit count or FAR for multi-family and mixed-use districts

bestPractices.title: Performance Zoning
bestPractices.description: Allows different uses to co-locate within a zone as long as the development achieves specified performance creteria an planning goals (eg. Neighborhood compatibility, transportation, open space, etc)

bestPractices.title: Cluster development
bestPractices.description: Zone for cluster development to introduce a mixture of housing types and densities

bestPractices.title: Cottage housing
bestPractices.description: Zone for small, attached or detached dwelling units within a development project within single-family housing zones

bestPractices.title: Infill Development
bestPractices.description: Building housing in built-up areas with vacant land, and/or redeveloping existing properties to make more efficient use of the land

bestPractices.title: Mixed-use development
bestPractices.description: Co-locate two or more types of land uses in a building or project, can include affordable housing

bestPractices.title: Small lot development
bestPractices.description: Allow development on lots smaller than the typically allowed in single family zoning districts

bestPractices.title: Zero lot line development
bestPractices.description: Flexible setback regulations to allow housing to be sited on the property line, creating more compact development and maximizing usable space

bestPractices.title: Mobile/Manufactured homes
bestPractices.description: Allow for mobile and manufactured homes to be located in single-family zones to increase affordability and housing choice

bestPractices.title: Microhousing/Single Room Occupancy housing
bestPractices.description: Allow for smalle unit size in developments in exchange for shared amenities

bestPractices.title: Diverse housing arrangements
bestPractices.description: Enable co-op, co-housing, rent-to-own and other hybrid tenures as a way to improve affordbility and access for a broader range of households, including older adults

bestPractices.title: Lot subdivision for skinny housing
bestPractices.description: Allow larger single-family lots to be subdivided to create slimmer lots where two housing structures can be built

bestPractices.title: Transferable Development Rights
bestPractices.description: Allow density rights from at-risk affordable housing units to be 'bought' by developers as density credits, using the payment to upgrade or increase affordable housing units

bestPractices.title: Private Property Rehabilitation Fund
bestPractices.description: For private developers to use to upgrade affordable housing

bestPractices.title: Good Landlord' Loan Products
bestPractices.description: Rehabilitation loans for eligible homeowners, developers, nonprofits (etc.) who agree to rent to income-eligible tenants

bestPractices.title: Rent control
bestPractices.description: Mandates reasonable and gradual rent increases while ensuring landlords receive a fair return on investment

bestPractices.title: Tenant Right of First Refusal
bestPractices.description: Requires that residential tenants in any building up for sale or demolition must be offered the first opportunity to buy the buildingâ€”either individually as tenants, turning the building into condominiums, or by forming a tenant association and buying the building as a whole, usually in partnership with a developer of their choosing

bestPractices.title: Right to Remain
bestPractices.description: Right to remain as a renter or renew a tenancy following a (condo) conversation or sale

bestPractices.title: Rent Increase Limitations
bestPractices.description: Prohibits landlords from raising rent in first year lease

bestPractices.title: Rent Increase Notification
bestPractices.description: Requirement to provide up to 90 days notice for any rent increase. Other states have up to 60 days notice requirements. Notification requirements may be tied to amount of rent increase (CA) or type of tenant, such as older adult (RI)

bestPractices.title: Preference for Affordable Housing
bestPractices.description: Preferences for available subsidized units for individuals vulnerable to displacement

bestPractices.title: Right to Return
bestPractices.description: Preferences of available subsidized rental and homeownership units for individuals that have been displaced

bestPractices.title: Urban Renewal Subject Preference Policy
bestPractices.description: Top priority is given to families who owned property that was taken through eminent domain, and their descendants for affordable housing or downpayment assistance opportunities.

bestPractices.title: Racial Equity
bestPractices.description: Urge municipalities to apply a racial equity lens to their policies and programs, with clear responsibility for implementation and monitoring

bestPractices.title: Housing Production Plan
bestPractices.description: Five-year plan to guide housing development based on existing and projected demand, as well as development constraints and opportunities.

bestPractices.description: Yearly progress tracked through indicators based on annual goals

bestPractices.description: Ensure new development fits into character of community

bestPractices.title: Technical assistance
bestPractices.description: For communities and developers planning housing development

bestPractices.description: Authorizes a state grant or loan for a local government to do planning and environmental reviews to cover a particular neighborhood. Developers in the designated community also will have to reserve a certain percentage of homes for low- and middle-income residents and the cityâ€™s approvals there would be approved without delay.

bestPractices.title: Coalition Building
bestPractices.description: Build broad coalitions between housing, community, and small business groups

bestPractices.title: Public housing to mix-income or voucher conversion
bestPractices.description: City, developer, and tenant working groups to discuss, plan, implement, and inform tenants about the conversion process; proactive relocation assistance programs

bestPractices.title: Homeownership education and counseling
bestPractices.description: Guide potential homeowners on homeownership, mortgages and loans

bestPractices.title: Community engagement
bestPractices.description: Focus groups, forums, interviews, workshops

bestPractices.title: Story telling
bestPractices.description: Collect and share housing stories of low-income households to increase empathy and understanding

bestPractices.title: Advocacy and educational material
bestPractices.description: Guides, toolkits, brochures

bestPractices.title: Low-cost efficient construction techniques
bestPractices.description: 3D printed homes built for a fraction of traditional construction costs, already being piloted around the world

bestPractices.title: Pre-fab small housing
bestPractices.description: Ready-made housing that can be low-cost and easy to transport; includes small housing options such as ADUs and tiny houses

bestPractices.title: Modular construction
bestPractices.description: Parts are built indoors, at a mass-scale, for lower-cost, quicker construction; can be used for high-rise construction

bestPractices.title: Timber construction
bestPractices.description: Permit construction of cross laminated timber for increased installation and finishes savings

bestPractices.title: Chapter 40T
bestPractices.description: Preserves existing privately-owned affordable housing by allowing a right of first refusal to DHCD or its designee to purchase housing and establishes protections for tenants

bestPractices.title: CA AB1521
bestPractices.description: Requires owners to accept a qualified offer to purchase an apartment complex with expiring affordability restrictions from someone who pledges to continue renting the homes to low-income residents

bestPractices.title: Chapter 40B
bestPractices.description: Allows developers to override local zoning of communities that have less than 10% subsidized housing if they provide 20-25% affordable housing in their project

bestPractices.title: CA SB35
bestPractices.description: Forces cities to approve projects that comply with existing zoning if not enough housing has been built to keep pace with state home-building targets. Projects must reserve a certain percentage of homes for low-income residents and pay construction workers union-level wages and abide by union-standard hiring rules

bestPractices.title: CA AB73
bestPractices.description: City receives money when it designates a particular community for more housing and then additional dollars once it starts issueing permits for new homes. At least 20% of housing must be reserved for low or middle-income residents

bestPractices.title: Housing Choice Designation
bestPractices.description: Preferential access to Commonwealth grant programs and ability to apply for a new dedicated grant program for communities that have increased their housing stock and set policies to encourage future sustainable growth

bestPractices.title: CA AB 879
bestPractices.description: Instructs cities to analyze how long it takes developers to actually build their projects once theyâ€™ve been approved, and then take steps to shorten that time

bestPractices.title: Great Neighborhoods Legislation (House 2420 and Senate 81)
bestPractices.description: Support increased housing choices for households by limiting Town's restrictive zoning against multifamily housing and ADUs (not yet approved)

bestPractices.title: Chapter 40R
bestPractices.description: Permits overlay districts to be created that encourage smart growth and ENCOURAGES development through financial incentives and design control
